Parameters: Study population characteristics (age, sex, race/ethnicity, SES); geographic region; respiratory diagnoses (asthma, COPD, pneumonia); disease severity; medication use; smoking status; pre-existing conditions
Environmental exposures (air pollution, wildfire smoke, PM2.5, PM10); allergens; weather conditions; wildfire events

Hospital admission rates (per 100,000 population); ED visit rates; Respiratory diagnosis-specific admissions (ICD codes); Exacerbation severity metrics; Relative risk or odds ratio per unit increase in PM2.5; Population-attributable risk; Temporal trends; Association measures (risk ratios, odds ratios)
